title: Systems Engineer - Icing
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. Icing Systems Engineer
Your role and your team: 
As a Systems Engineer you will be part of a multidisciplinary Chief Engineering team responsible for the design, development and certification of the Ice Protection System (IPS) of our aircraft.
You will report directly to the Engineering Manager for Systems Engineering & Architecture and be deployed to the Chief Engineering team. The team is responsible for the design analysis and development of the aircraft IPS from concept through to detailed design, testing and into serial production.
From parts to systems development, you will play a key role in bringing our innovative aircraft to life.
Your Day to Day: 
Support the development of the aircraft IPS comprising of parts and assemblies, throughout their lifecycle in compliance with the standards and regulations such as SC-VTOL, ARP4754A, DO-160.
Definition, validation and management of system, subsystem, and component requirements, including the definition of verification items
Assist in the development of integration, test processes and procedures that regard the relevant system and the interfacing systems or structure
Negotiate with certification authorities for the definition of Means of Compliance, qualification and certification activities
Generate and manage the IPS Validation & Verification plan
Create / check and approve test requests, test plans
Interface with the Lilium Test organisation to define and execute the full scope of testing required to develop and certify the system
Interact with professionals and departments, including design, testing and external suppliers, to proceed with the activities most relevant to the Validation & Verification of the relevant system
Create /support certification related documentation
Work closely with the design and calculation engineers regarding design, interfaces, and control
Specification and support of system validation and verification according to acceptable means of compliance in accordance with ARP4754A, DO-160
Generate and maintain related processes and procedures
Your Profile:
University degree in Aerospace Engineering or Mechanical Engineering (MSc/M.Eng preferred)
Minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience in the aerospace industry is required
Experience in requirements management tools, such as Siemens Polarion or IBM Rational Doors is required
Experience developing and working to system requirements is required
Experience in planning, developing and managing verification activities is required
Experience in developing and qualifying aircraft systems is required; preferably CS-E, CS/FAR-27 or CS/FAR-23
Experience in generating/approving EASA/FAA certification documentation, preferably CS-E, CS/FAR-27 or CS/FAR-23 is beneficial
Fundamental knowledge of aircraft design principles is required
High level of self-reliance with the ability to work in a team, as well as autonomously is required
Experience in working with external suppliers and managing the interaction for the activities needed for Validation and Verification is beneficial
Hands-on experience in defining and executing testing is beneficial
Awareness of EASA Part 21J requirements is beneficial
Experience in interacting with certification authorities for the qualification and certification activities of aerospace systems is beneficial
Experience with ARP4754A is beneficial
Lilium is looking for individuals with a strong motivation and passion to contribute to developing a new technology and bringing it to the market. A target-oriented, driven work style with willingness to proactively overcome impediments in everyday activities and interaction with colleagues is required. Individuals will need the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing work environment.
Fluent English language skills are essential, fluent German or any other language is beneficial
 
 
 Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!
Life at Lilium:
The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.
 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
